channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Zakir Hussain, legendary tabla virtuoso who defied genres, dies at 73
item.description: Hussain's career spanned over five decades, during which he was revered as both a national treasure in India and admired worldwide.
item.content:encoded:
Hussain's career spanned over five decades, during which he was revered as both a national treasure in India and admired worldwide.

(Image credit: Manjunath Kiran)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: U.S. has made contact with Syrian rebel group HTS, Blinken says
item.description: Comments by Secretary of State Antony Blinken this weekend were the first time a U.S. official has acknowledged contact with the Syrian rebel group that drove Bashar al-Assad from power.
item.content:encoded:
Comments by Secretary of State Antony Blinken this weekend were the first time a U.S. official has acknowledged contact with the Syrian rebel group that drove Bashar al-Assad from power.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: This cookbook is unlike any other from India. Pass the honeycomb, please!
item.description: In Dalit Kitchens of Marathwada, Shahu Patole pays tribute to a cuisine that has long been considered not worthy of documentation. We interviewed Patole — and are sharing some of his recipes.
item.content:encoded:
Dalit Kitchens of Marathwada.'/>

In Dalit Kitchens of Marathwada, Shahu Patole pays tribute to a cuisine that has long been considered not worthy of documentation. We interviewed Patole — and are sharing some of his recipes.

(Image credit: Maya Levin for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: At least 11 dead in the French territory of Mayotte as Cyclone Chido causes devastating damage
item.description: At least 11 people have died after Cyclone Chido caused devastating damage in the French territory of Mayotte in the Indian Ocean, France's Interior Ministry said Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
At least 11 people have died after Cyclone Chido caused devastating damage in the French territory of Mayotte in the Indian Ocean, France's Interior Ministry said Sunday.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Ilana Glazer appreciates how becoming a parent forced them to draw some lines
item.description: Ilana Glazer is grateful for the limits of parenthood. On Wild Card this week, Glazer opens up about how parenthood has allowed them to draw boundaries and why they increasingly love their alone time.
item.content:encoded:
Ilana Glazer is grateful for the limits of parenthood. On Wild Card this week, Glazer opens up about how parenthood has allowed them to draw boundaries and why they increasingly love their alone time.

(Image credit: Dia Dipasupil/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: Trump appoints foreign policy adviser Richard Grenell as special missions envoy
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump announced Saturday that he's picked longtime foreign policy adviser Richard Grenell to serve as an envoy for special missions, dealing with tough foreign policy decisions.
item.content:encoded:
President-elect Donald Trump announced Saturday that he's picked longtime foreign policy adviser Richard Grenell to serve as an envoy for special missions, dealing with tough foreign policy decisions.

(Image credit: Darko Vojinovic/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Storms across U.S. bring heavy snow, dangerous ice and a tornado in California
item.description: Inclement weather plagued areas of the U.S. over the weekend, with heavy snow in upstate New York, a major ice storm in the Midwest and severe weather warnings around Lake Tahoe.
item.content:encoded:
Inclement weather plagued areas of the U.S. over the weekend, with heavy snow in upstate New York, a major ice storm in the Midwest and severe weather warnings around Lake Tahoe.

(Image credit: Nic Coury)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump's tariffs threat is dividing business owners across the country
item.description: Businesses are divided over Trump's plan to impose sweeping tariffs. Some companies welcome the protection from foreign competition, while others worry about rising costs and retaliation.
item.content:encoded:
Businesses are divided over Trump's plan to impose sweeping tariffs. Some companies welcome the protection from foreign competition, while others worry about rising costs and retaliation.

(Image credit: courtesy Peter Elitzer)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: One week into post-Assad rule in Syria - a view from Damascus
item.description: Morning Edition host Leila Fadel reports from Damascus, in the first week in a half-century that the Assad family did not rule the country.
item.content:encoded: Morning Edition host Leila Fadel reports from Damascus, in the first week in a half-century that the Assad family did not rule the country.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Assad's fall came too late for one NPR reporter's father
item.description: Assad's fall came too late for the father of NPR's Diaa Hadid, who was briefly detained by Syrian forces during their occupation of northern Lebanon.
item.content:encoded: Assad's fall came too late for the father of NPR's Diaa Hadid, who was briefly detained by Syrian forces during their occupation of northern Lebanon.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid
